utterance.content: There aren't any. She had a vitamin deficiency, and we corrected it, an ectopic pregnancy, we removed it.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: But her heart problem won’t go away, and now something's wrong with her brain.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I have complete confidence in you guys.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Who wants to go service House so this patient can live?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We can do this without him. Maybe something happened during the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The surgery was on her bowel, not her brain.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Anxiety, stroke, Tourette's could all cause eye blinking.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And cause her heart to beat faster. It's slowing down.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: MS. If a lesion took out the sympathetic innervation of her heart, it'd explain the bradycardia and the blinking.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But not the vitamin deficiency or the ectopic pregnancy. House would want a unifying theory.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House is gone, and so are those symptoms. MS explains everything that’s wrong with her right now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Start her on interferon for MS.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Mind if I come in?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not at all. You mind if I leave?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I told you not to take that case specifically so you could deal with Wilson.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the two ended up dovetailing rather nicely, don't you think?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is this how you show your friendship? By bludgeoning him with guilt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because he's my friend, I know what works on him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, I can't let you walk away from a patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then fire me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're willing to risk your career, but you're not willing to say you're sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told him I'm sorry. He didn't believe it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, make him believe it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't believe it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't want to believe it Because if you tell Wilson how you actually feel about him, about what happened to Amber, about your part in what happened, and he walks out the door anyway… If you make yourself vulnerable for once in your nerve-deadening, emotionally obliterating... You're doing the same thing he is. You're running away. Only he's not killing anyone in the process.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Where's Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's not feeling well.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Was MS his idea?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We work as a team. You know how it is. Collaborative. Sometimes it's hard to tell where an idea comes from.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: But you're not… really a team. You work for him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And you work for Patty. I'm sure a lot of her ideas are actually —

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: She would be fine without me. I'd be nothing without her.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe if you just had the chance. I'm… I'm sure you’ve learned a lot.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Not everybody’s created equal. Does Dr. House think I have MS?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes. Did you just shiver? You're running a slight fever.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Is that bad?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It means we were wrong about the MS.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You had my cable disconnected!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, that's quite a leap. Just because I happen to have a 31-person maintenance department, each of whom you’ve personally abused at some point —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why? Did you think I'm okay with letting someone die, but I'm gonna fold if I can't watch celebrity bowling?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That is not an unreasonable theory. Especially with only ten minutes till your favorite soap. Oh, gee, is this the remote from the doctors' lounge?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is your 911? Good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Stop! I'm withholding your salary history from every hospital in the tri-state area.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You go, girl.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And I'm permanently setting every TV in this building to the pottery channel unless you both sit down. Welcome to couples counseling.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The timing fits.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The location doesn't, unless her brain’s in her bowels.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If bacteria entered her bloodstream, it could have caused an infection in her brain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The surgery went fine. You were there, you saw.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Peptostreptococcus could explain the blinking and —

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. You want to watch a grainy video and have an epiphany.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shut up. You're making me miss House's mocking.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know you told us it was none of our business, but if House thinks that your Huntington’s is affecting you, maybe it really —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's not, because I don't have —

utterance.content: You're desperate to do this without him. You're not trying to cure her. You're trying to prove —

utterance.content: Stop the tape. Zoom in. On the anastomosis, that little bump.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's a hematoma. A harmless pocket of blood, which is why Chase ignored it during the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Could be a ganglioma, which is why Chase shouldn't have ignored it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's an abnormal growth of nerves, it could be causing all the patient's symptoms. We have to open her up again. Get a piece of it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what do you want to tell us?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Nothing. Nothing I say is gonna change anything. You guys need to talk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, you should read the psych literature. Repression's gaining a lot of fans. What you don't face can't crush you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Talk to each other.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How you doing? Good?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Eh, eh, eh, eh. Sit! See, the two of you are friends. Look how you both —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Think you're an idiot. We both also eat with forks. That doesn't really prove —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Talk to him! Tell him how you feel about what he's doing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told him he's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell him what you think about him leaving.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think he's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're an idiot. He's in pain. And your response is just to emotionally blackmail him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You told me what your position is on that one. You're against it, right?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She hasn't told you in front of me. She needs to prove she's on my side.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Go to hell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So much for that theory.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry you lost Amber. I cannot imagine what it is you're going through. But it will not get better by you walking away from everyone that cares about you. Do you think Amber would want you to walk away?

utterance.content: Nobody at this hospital even liked Amber.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Same time next week?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want me to do a second major surgery on a patient we almost lost during a first major surgery to see if she needs a third major surgery?

utterance.content: We need a piece of the ganglioma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then you're talking about another patient. Yours doesn't have a ganglioma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And if there is one and you missed it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then you're talking about another surgeon. I didn't miss anything.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But we're not talking about another videotape. This one showed a bump we need to biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A bump? Oh, yeah. My grandfather died of a bump. She can't survive a second round of general anesthesia, let alone a third.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You'd do this for House.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Then what do you suggest? Because the patient's got a high fever, a low heart rate, and a dim chance of survival if we stand here like idiots.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then I suggest you don’t stand there like idiots.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: How do you get coal out of a mountain when it's someone else’s mountain? If we don't have House, it doesn't mean we can't think like House.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But it does mean we don't have to talk like him.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You don't dig down. You go in from the side. We insert a lighted scope through the rectum, move the intestine till we find the ganglioma, then push it to the surface. Where we see the light, we cut.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We'll make as small an incision as we can. But unfortunately, it'll be very painful. After your surgery experience, we can't give you anesthesia.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Can I talk to Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. We can do this. We know what we're doing.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: I don't mean to be insulting, but my former boss didn't insist on me coming here because of you or —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your former boss?

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: I've been replaced.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry. You must be —

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: I'm fine. She has a big Beijing trip. Ton of work to do. She can't just wait for me to get better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We've been well-trained. We'll take good care of you. How can you let her treat you like a footstool?

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: The world needs flunkies.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Don't say that. You're better than that.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: I have no problem with it. Why do you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Because... life is short. I mean, yours could've ended in that surgery. You'd have never lived for yourself. What kind of feminist…? We can have anything.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: No, we can’t. We can aspire to anything. But we don't get it just because we want it. I would rather spend my life close to the birds than waste it wishing I had wings.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Switching on the light.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Advance toward the anastomosis.

utterance.content: There, I see it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Don't look down.

utterance.content: Scalpel.

utterance.content: So your last day is Friday.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm gonna miss you.

utterance.content: You shouldn't go.

utterance.content: Did House ask you to talk to me, or are you trying to save the patient? Because there'll always be another —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House asked me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And you're doing it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I told him to go to hell.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But I think he's right. You think you're making a rational choice. You think the worst is over. And then... Six months later you look back and you realize you didn't know what you were doing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are you saying the pain doesn’t go away?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It gets easier. Not in two months. Not in two years. But no, it never really goes away.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Being here… this building… I was just in the lounge. I kept staring at Amber's locker.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I saw a guy wearing a scarf this morning. The color reminded me of his eyes. We lived 500 miles from here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have to do something.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Then do it. But don't think it’s the right choice, because... There isn't one.

utterance.content: It's not a ganglioma. The problem wasn’t the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Abnormally deposited proteins. It's amyloidosis. That would explain the blinking and the low heart rate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Only way to treat amyloidosis is to treat whatever’s causing it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not as if a lot of things cause amyloid. Rheumatoid arthritis.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Familial Mediterranean fever.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Well, we can't all be right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But you can all be wrong. The patient's joints don't hurt, abdominal pain went away when the fetus did, and no palpable lymph nodes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Got anything constructive to say?

utterance.content: Sorry. Sorry. Um, she has lots and lots of palpable lymph nodes, joint and abdominal pain. She'll be better by dinnertime. utterance.content: You want me to make the call?

utterance.content: There seems to be some disagreement.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And this isn't just a pretext to pressure me into staying?

utterance.content: Does it look like a pretext?

utterance.content: No. She really is dying, isn't she? Inflammation, enlarged nuclei, some mitotic activity. It could be lymphoma.

utterance.content: There are no palpable lymph nodes.

utterance.content: It makes it less likely, but it doesn't rule it out. I'm an oncologist. I see cancer. Show it to an immunologist, they'll see autoimmune.

utterance.content: I already showed it to an immunologist. We'll start her on chemo. You should leave. House doesn't want to lose his sidekick. Cuddy doesn't want to lose her check on House. No one's talking about what you want.

utterance.content: It's not that I want to.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Want to, need to. If there's any chance that being away from here will make your life even a little bit easier, do it. That's what everyone else here would do.

utterance.content: Don't expect anything to change too fast.

utterance.content: Why?

utterance.content: Sometimes just knowing you’re being treated helps.

utterance.content: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have gotten angry at you. Your choices are your choices.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: You're not like me. Maybe you have wings.

utterance.content: I have Huntington’s Chorea. Dozen years or so, my nervous system, my cognitive skills, even my emotional balance... they'll all start to fray. I won't be able to fly. I won't be able to walk. I won't be able to breathe.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: And you want to make sure your life matters.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't want to just... be tightening bolts and following instructions. I want something... to be different because of me.

utterance.content: I am. Not just 'cause you saved my life. I'm applying for a job at a foundation, running the finance division. And I don't know if I'm gonna get it, but if I don’t... There are other foundations.

utterance.content: It's almost 4:00. Soap time. Nurses' remote. Works in the doctors' lounge.

utterance.content: Why do you think Wilson’s leaving?

utterance.content: How many times do I have to use the word "idiot"?

utterance.content: And that's a good enough answer for you? Whenever anyone does anything out of the norm, you have to tell them what screwed-up process is really at work in their head. utterance.content: Try it sometime. You'll see why.

utterance.content: You look 37.

utterance.content: I am 37.

utterance.content: You looked 27 last week. Unless I blacked out for ten years. Your skin —

utterance.content: She's got lymphoma. The chemo's probably —

utterance.content: She's getting better. Bradycardia's improving. We didn't need —

utterance.content: She was pounding her legs during the hallucinations.

utterance.content: It's not lymphoma.

utterance.content: Hey, don't — no, no, no.

utterance.content: My bad. Thought no meant yes. Those aren't bruises. They're mycobacterial lesions. She has diffuse lepromatous leprosy. Must have caught it on one of her overseas estrogen tours. utterance.content: Leprosy? Like where my limbs fall off?

utterance.content: Actually, this is the flattering one. It's also known as "pretty leprosy." It doesn't disfigure, it makes your skin look younger, smoother. Don't let the girls hear. utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: She's happy you’re gonna be fine. But she'd be happier if you were gonna be fine five minutes ago.

utterance.content: Tests confirmed Dr. House's diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When you got pregnant, the physical stress triggered nodosum leprosum. A common complication of leprosy. Inflamed the nerves to your heart. Made it hard to absorb vitamins, scarred your fallopian tubes. It explains everything.

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: Better prescribe me some skin cream too, huh?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You might want it for those job interviews.

utterance.content: I'm going back on the road with Patty. My replacement flamed out. She says I can manage some projects on my own, carve out more of a role.

utterance.content: Do you really think she can change?

utterance.speaker: Lou
utterance.content: I don't know. The truth is, I’m not sure I —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You can change.

utterance.content: No. I'm not sure I want her to change. She's reasonable. She's just another employer, then I'm just... another employee. In a weird way, I matter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like you better now that you're dying.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You took a shot.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's going back to work for that idiot. It's pathetic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You thought something would change?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She almost died because of that job. Yeah, I… I thought —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Almost dying changes nothing. Dying changes everything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I know I didn't try to kill her. I know I didn't want her hurt. I know it was a freak accident. But I feel like crap, and she's dead because of me.

utterance.content: I don't blame you. I wanted to. I tried to. I must have reviewed Amber's case file 100 times to find a way. But it wasn't your fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then we're okay? I mean, I know you're not, but... Maybe I can help.
